definition: to buy and sell/to do business/to trade/to deal

to do/to make/to produce/to write/to compose/to act as/to engage in/to hold (a party)/to be/to become/to function (in some capacity)/to serve as/to be used for/to form (a bond or relationship)/to pretend/to feign/to act a part/to put on appearance
to buy/to purchase
to sell/to betray/to spare no effort/to show off or flaunt

sentences.english: So I said, Obama, let's go into a business.
sentences.chinese: 所以我說，奧巴馬，我們可以做買賣了。

sentences.english: These charts show how one trader makes his buy and sell decisions.
sentences.chinese: 這些圖表明瞭交易者如何如何做買賣決定。

sentences.english: Please teach me how to run a business.
sentences.chinese: 請你教教我如何做買賣。

sentences.english: For example, do you remember that Taco Bell commercial with the little dog?
sentences.chinese: 比如，你記得那個同“小狗”做買賣的塔可鍾嗎？

sentences.english: Antonio was a very rich man who owned many ships. He traded with foreign countries.
sentences.chinese: 他富甲一方，擁有許多船隻，並常和其他國家做買賣。

sentences.english: We can't continue doing business along the old lines.
sentences.chinese: 我們不能再按老辦法來做買賣了。

sentences.english: Chatting with other residents and commercial activities are also possible.
sentences.chinese: 在社區裏也可以同他人聊天，做買賣。

sentences.english: One of our guiding principles in doing business is to abide by contracts and keep good faith .
sentences.chinese: 我們做買賣的知道原則之一就是重合同守信用。

sentences.english: Many farmers use mobiles to trade and check market prices.
sentences.chinese: 許多農民利用手機做買賣以及查詢市場價格。

sentences.english: I told you, I'm losing money as it is.
sentences.chinese: 跟你說過呀，我這可是賠本兒做買賣。

sentences.english: Then he that had received the five talents went and traded with the same, and made them other five talents.
sentences.chinese: 那領五千的，隨既拿去做買賣，另外賺了五千。

definition: lit. to settle accounts after autumn/settle scores at an opportune moment (idiom)
to behead
toss a peach, get back a plum (idiom); to return a favor/to exchange gifts/Scratch my back, and I'll scratch yours.
to exaggerate
to die without a burial site/to die a pauper/a tragic end
pinyin: si3 wu2 zang4 shen1 zhi1 di4

definition: see 賒賬|赊账[she1 zhang4]
to whisper to one another's ear
to force sb to buy or sell/to trade using coercion
impoverished/backward both economically and culturally
lit. neither a relative nor a friend (idiom)/fig. unrelated to one another in any way
to bow before (idiom)/to capitulate
lit. to hang a sheep's head while selling dog meat (idiom)/fig. to cheat/dishonest advertising/wicked deeds carried out under banner of virtue
pinyin: gua4 yang2 tou2 mai4 gou3 rou4

definition: hunger strike
(not) a single person/(no) one
daring/presumptuous/daredevil
to return something to its rightful owner
